preclusion: RE2280 Real Estate Space Market I
moduleDescription: This foundation course employs economic analysis, especially microeconomic principles, to provide a big-picture view of the urbanization process and real estate markets. The topics include economic factors driving city formation; market forces shaping urban spatial structure; determinants influencing metropolitan and regional growth; the linkages among location, land use, and land value; suburbanization and sub centres; urban transportation; and land-use policies.
